metadata.name: Black #1
metadata.description:
One of the child workers working in the valley brings water to his family.Although this carbon monoxide gas from charcoal furnaces creates cinematographic scenes, serious lung problems occur in workers in later ages.
This boy carrying water is 8 years old and has never been to school.Because his family leads a nomadic life.There will be no school life as they migrate about every three years.
His family made their first migration after the bloody conflicts in eastern Turkey in the 1990s.
And since then, their nomadic life continues. Just like the tens of thousands of Kurdish families who migrated west in the 1990s.
The title of the documentary, REŞ, means black in Kurdish.One of the workers said, 'Our work is black, but our foreheads are white'.This word means that they are honest and honorable people.
©Serkan Çolak
His projects deals with different topics such as urbanization process and focus on issues around cultural diversity,mmigration,political issues and human rights in Turkey
